00034 KitAODbEntry::KitAODbEntry() {
00035   m_linenum=0;
00036   m_pc1=0.0;
00037   m_means=0.0;
00038 }
00039 KitAODbEntry::KitAODbEntry(int linenum,float pc1,float means) {
00040   m_linenum=0;
00041   m_pc1=pc1;
00042   m_means=means;
00043 }

00047 KitAODb::KitAODb() {
00048   clear();
00049 }
00050 
00051 KitAODb::~KitAODb() {
00052   clear();
00053 }
00054 
00055 void KitAODb::clear() {
00056   m_classiferAValue=-9999.9;
00057   m_classiferOValue=-9999.9;
00058   //
00059   m_filename.clear();
00060 
00061   // delete the entries in the set.
00062   for (entry_iter_t i=m_entries.begin();
00063        i!=m_entries.end();
00064        i++) {
00065     delete *i;
00066   }
00067   m_entries.clear();
00068   //
00069   m_name2entry.clear();
00070   //
00071   m_added_count=0;
00072   m_file_probeset_count = 0;
00073 }
00074

00077 double KitAODb::getClassiferAValue() const {
00078   return m_classiferAValue;
00079 }
00080 double KitAODb::getClassiferOValue() const {
00081   return m_classiferOValue;
00082 }
00083 
00084 KitAODbEntry* KitAODb::findEntry(const std::string& e_name) {
00085   KitAODb::name2entry_iter_t i=m_name2entry.find(e_name);
00086   if (i==m_name2entry.end()) {
00087     return NULL;
00088   }
00089   return i->second;
00090 }
00091 
00092 void KitAODb::addEntry(const std::string& e_name,KitAODbEntry* e_ptr) {
00093   // bump the number of additions made.
00094   m_added_count++;
00095   //
00096   KitAODbEntry* found_ptr=findEntry(e_name);
00097   //printf("%d: %s => %p\n",m_entry_count,e_name.c_str(),e_ptr);
00098   APT_ERR_ASSERT(((found_ptr==NULL)||(found_ptr==e_ptr)),"duplicate name '"+e_name+"' found.");
00099   // done if it is already in the map...
00100   if (found_ptr!=NULL) {
00101     return;
00102   }
00103   // ...not in the maps, add it.
00104   name2entry_val_t e_pair(e_name,e_ptr);
00105   m_name2entry.insert(e_pair);
00106   //
00107   m_entries.insert(e_ptr);
00108 }
00109 
00110 //////////
00111 
00112 int KitAODb::addedCount() const {
00113   return m_added_count;
00114 }
00115 
00116 int KitAODb::nameCount() const {
00117   return m_name2entry.size();
00118 }
00119 
00120 int KitAODb::entryCount() const {
00121   return m_entries.size();
00122 }

00126 void KitAODb::readTsv(const std::string& filename) {
00127   m_filename=filename;
00128 
00129   Verbose::out(1,"Reading KitAODb: '"+m_filename+"'...");
00130 
00131   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00132   APT_ERR_ASSERT(tsv.open(m_filename)==affx::TSV_OK,"open of '"+m_filename+"' failed.");
00133 
00134   // check the version
00135   int kit_ao_format_version=-1;
00136   if (tsv.getHeader("db-format-version",kit_ao_format_version)==affx::TSV_OK) {
00137     APT_ERR_ASSERT(kit_ao_format_version==1,"we only read v1 format files.");
00138   }
00139 
00140   //
00141   m_classiferAValue=0.0;
00142   APT_ERR_ASSERT((tsv.getHeader("classifier-cutoff-a-value",m_classiferAValue)==affx::TSV_OK),
00143                  "The header key 'classifer-cutoff-a-value' is required.");
00144   m_classiferOValue=0.0;
00145   APT_ERR_ASSERT((tsv.getHeader("classifier-cutoff-o-value",m_classiferOValue)==affx::TSV_OK),
00146                  "The header key 'classifer-cutoff-o-value' is required.");
00147   // 
00148   if (tsv.getHeader("probeset-count",m_file_probeset_count)!=affx::TSV_OK) {
00149     m_file_probeset_count=0;
00150   }
00151 
00152   // we require the these two columns (PC1 & means)
00153   int pc1_cidx=tsv.cname2cidx(0,"pc1","PC1");
00154   APT_ERR_ASSERT((pc1_cidx>=0),"the 'pc1' column was not found.");
00155 
00156   int means_cidx=tsv.cname2cidx(0,"means");
00157   APT_ERR_ASSERT((means_cidx>=0),"the 'means' column was not found.");
00158 
00159   // for compatiablity with other versions of this file.
00160   int probeset_id_cidx=tsv.cname2cidx(0,"probeset_id","GS_probeset_id","CEU_probeset_id");
00161   // and we require a column of probeset names.
00162   APT_ERR_ASSERT(probeset_id_cidx!=-1,"File did not have a probeset id column.");
00163 
00164   //
00165   std::string entry_name;
00166   while (tsv.nextLevel(0)==affx::TSV_OK) {
00167     KitAODbEntry* entry_ptr=new KitAODbEntry();
00168     APT_ERR_ASSERT(entry_ptr!=NULL,"new KitAODbEntry() failed.");
00169     entry_ptr->m_linenum=tsv.lineNumber();
00170     tsv.get(0,pc1_cidx,entry_ptr->m_pc1);
00171     tsv.get(0,means_cidx,entry_ptr->m_means);
00172     tsv.get(0,probeset_id_cidx,entry_name);
00173     //
00174     this->addEntry(entry_name,entry_ptr);
00175   }
00176 
00177   tsv.close();
00178 
00179   // check that we read the correct number.
00180   if (m_file_probeset_count>0) {
00181     APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_file_probeset_count==addedCount(),"Didnt read the correct number of items from the input file.");
00182   }
00183 }
00184 
00185 void KitAODb::writeTsv(const std::string& filename) {
00186   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00187 
00188   tsv.addHeaderComment("## This is a KitAO DB file.");
00189   tsv.addHeaderComment("");
00190   tsv.addHeaderComment("The version of the file format.");
00191   tsv.addHeader("db-format-version",1);
00192 
00193   tsv.addHeaderComment("");
00194   tsv.addHeaderComment("The file which was read in.");
00195   tsv.addHeader("original-filename",m_filename);
00196 
00197   tsv.addHeaderComment("");
00198   tsv.addHeaderComment("The cutoff value.");
00199   tsv.addHeader("classifier-cutoff-a-value",m_classiferAValue);
00200   tsv.addHeader("classifier-cutoff-o-value",m_classiferOValue);
00201 
00202   tsv.addHeaderComment("");
00203   tsv.addHeaderComment("The number of probesets.");
00204   tsv.addHeader("probeset-count",addedCount());
00205 
00206   tsv.addHeaderComment("");
00207   tsv.defineColumn(0,0,"probeset_id");
00208   tsv.defineColumn(0,1,"PC1");
00209   tsv.defineColumn(0,2,"means");
00210   
00211   tsv.writeTsv_v1(filename);
00212 
00213   for (name2entry_iter_t i=m_name2entry.begin();
00214        i!=m_name2entry.end();
00215        i++) {
00216     //
00217     tsv.set(0,0,i->first);
00218     tsv.set(0,1,i->second->m_pc1);
00219     tsv.set(0,2,i->second->m_means);
00220     tsv.writeLevel(0);
00221   }
00222   tsv.close();
00223 }
